content.question: A cylindrical resistor of resistance <math alttext="R sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and length <math alttext="L sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is created using a total volume <math alttext="V sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of a flexible material with constant resistivity. The resistor is carefully stretched so that its volume does not change, it remains a cylinder, and its length doubles. Which of the following graphs best shows the resistance of the wire as a function of the length of the wire as the wire is stretched?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is unlabeled, and from left to right the values L sub 0 and 2 L sub 0 are indicated along it. The vertical axis is unlabeled, and the value R sub 0 is indicated along it. The line begins at the point with coordinates L sub 0, comma R sub 0, and slants upward and to the right. It ends above 2 L sub 0 along the horizontal axis, and above R sub 0 along the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is unlabeled, and from left to right the values L sub 0 and 2 L sub 0 are indicated along it. The vertical axis is unlabeled, and the value R sub 0 is indicated along it. The curve begins at the point with coordinates L sub 0, comma R sub 0, and curves upward and to the right. It ends above 2 L sub 0 along the horizontal axis, and above R sub 0 along the vertical axis.

It ends above 2 L sub 0 along the horizontal axis.
